_comment: Created by EFisher on 24/01/2014 17:06:05 using v2.0
title: How long do patients have to wait to see someone at the GP surgery?
analysis_commentary: Over a quarter (26%) of patients in 2012/13 had to wait 15 minutes or longer to see the GP or nurse after their appointment time, which hasn't dramatically changed compared to the preceding three years. Initial figures for January - September 2013 suggests no recent changes in this trend. A similar percentage of patients (25% 2012/13) said that they felt they had to wait “a bit too long” and a further 9% said that they had to wait “far too long”. Again in the three proceeding years, these proportions were very similar. Although between 2009/10 and 2012/13 there has been a decrease of 5% in the percentage of patients who said that they “don't normally have to wait too long”.
